intro: Erigeron bithynicus, commonly known as the Bithynian fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. Erigeron bithynicus is often found in open habitats and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
